newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Dhaka stocks close up on institutional support.
newsitem.headline: Dhaka stocks close up on institutional support.

text.p: Dhaka stocks closed higher on buying pressure by the small investors and support from institutional investors, brokers said.
The Dhaka Stock Exchange (DSE) all-share price index rose 26.46 points or 2.13 percent at 1,265.06 on a turnover of 104.3 million taka. Of 124 traded issues 79 gained and 42 lost.
"Institutional investor like state-owned investment corporation of Bangladesh supported the market to keep the morale of investors high especially after a recent bear-run," said one broker.
Singer Bangladesh lost 739 taka to 8,208 and National Tubes gained 70 to 1,225. Friday is the weekend in Bangladesh.
